title: Court puts reinstatement of cannabis commission head on hold
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: A judge ordered the reinstatement of Shannon O'Brien as Cannabis Control Commission chair, but the state has filed an appeal.
O'Brien was accused of misconduct by State Treasurer Deborah Goldberg, who appealed the ruling to halt her reinstatement.
The appeal stay delays O'Brien's return as chair, with her lawyers given until Wednesday to respond to the court's decision.

title: Man charged with murder after woman, 38, found dead in Lynn, DA says
author: Audrey Cooney
bullets: Police found a 38-year-old woman dead in Lynn on Newhall Street early Sunday morning, according to Essex County DA.
A 30-year-old Lynn man was arrested and charged with murder, Essex County District Attorney Paul Tucker announced.
The man is scheduled for arraignment on Monday in Lynn District Court; names have not been released.

title: Jakobi Meyers shuts down questions about trade request: ‘Happy to be a Raider’
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Jakobi Meyers requested a trade from the Raiders over contract issues but expressed contentment staying with the team.
Meyers recorded eight catches for 97 yards in the Raiders' 20-13 win over the Patriots at Gillette Stadium.
Las Vegas Raiders denied Meyers' trade request as he is in the final year of his 3-year $33 million contract.

title: Tornado confirmed in Mass. town as powerful storm sweeps over region
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: A tornado was confirmed in Holden, Massachusetts, during Saturday's storm, with a damage survey delayed until Monday.
The National Weather Service issued severe thunderstorm watches from Baltimore to northern Maine, affecting almost all of Massachusetts.
Storm damage included fallen trees and power outages, with significant impacts in Paxton and Holyoke, but no injuries reported.

title: In a season promising change, the 2025 Patriots looked all too familiar in season opener
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: The 2025 Patriots opened the season with a 20-13 loss to the Las Vegas Raiders at Gillette Stadium.
Second-year QB Drake Maye and the Patriots struggled offensively in the second half, managing only 51 passing yards after halftime.
The Patriots' defense showed improvement with new additions, but allowed nine plays of 20+ yards against Raiders QB Geno Smith.

title: Will Campbell’s NFL debut was solid until things began to unravel late in the second half
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Rookie left-tackle Will Campbell struggled late in the Patriots' 20-13 loss to the Raiders, committing key penalties.
Campbell was involved in two sacks in the second half and had false start penalties impacting the Patriots' comeback efforts.
Despite issues, Campbell received praise from Raiders' Maxx Crosby, highlighting his potential and support from Coach McDaniels.

title: Lynn police officer on leave after becoming ‘suddenly incapacitated’ while on duty
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: A Lynn police officer was placed on administrative leave following a video showing him incapacitated during a traffic stop.
The incident appeared to be a medical episode, and the department is investigating all potential contributing factors.
The officer was seen not responding, struggling to stand, while bystanders accused him of being under the influence.

title: Patriots stock watch: Here’s who stood out and struggled against the Raiders
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Patriots lost season opener 20-13 to Raiders under new coach Mike Vrabel at Gillette Stadium.
Linebacker Harold Landry III impressed with 2.5 sacks, providing strong defense against Raiders' quarterback Geno Smith.
Running back struggles contributed to the Patriots' loss; team managed only 60 rushing yards on 18 carries.

title: Review & setlist: Dropkick Murphys come on strong, avert disaster at soggy Suffolk Downs
author: Marc Hirsh
bullets: Dropkick Murphys performed at the Seisiún festival at Suffolk Downs after a rain delay disrupted the schedule.
The concert resumed with a reduced crowd, as many attendees left due to poor communication during the storm.
Songs included 'The Boys Are Back', 'Skinhead On The MBTA', and a tribute to Shane McGowan of The Pogues.

title: Bill Belichick explains ‘simple’ reason why he decided to ban Patriots scout at UNC
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Bill Belichick confirmed banning a Patriots scout from UNC practices, citing an unwelcoming atmosphere towards himself.
The decision reflects strained relations between Belichick and the Patriots, following his departure in 2023.
Patriots head coach Mike Vrabel acknowledged Belichick's decision, emphasizing the need to adjust scouting strategies.
